snippet: Long Island College Hospital, in northern Brooklyn, was losing too much money, said Dr. John Williams, president of SUNY Downstate Medical Center, which runs it.
abstract: New York State university trustees will vote on whether to close Long Island College Hospital, despite protests from medical staff that northern Brooklyn will lose essential source of emergency care; officials of SUNY Downstate Medical Center, which runs Long Island College Hospital, say it is losing too much money.
lead_paragraph: Long Island College Hospital, in northern Brooklyn, was losing too much money, said Dr. John Williams, president of SUNY Downstate Medical Center, which runs it.

headline.seo: Vote This Week May Close Long Island College Hospital
headline.main: Vote This Week May Close a North Brooklyn Hospital
headline.print_headline: Vote This Week May Close A North Brooklyn Hospital
